coraliejames_art: I'm very sorry this happened to you. It's totally not ok for a practitioner to do anything to you that you haven't asked for or given clear consent to. I had a naturopath suddenly 'crack' my neck using a jerking action like a chiropractor. She was not a chiro, I prefer not to get chiro, she gave me no warning, I expected advice about herbs not physical manipulation. I told her to stop immediately and take her hands off me. I was quite young at the time but I knew she should have told me her plan and got consent first. Totally not ok. Your body. Your choice. I don't care what they think is best. They have to ask first. You are so right. Consent. Always.

matt_taxi_69: What was the point of this story to highlight who was white and who was black? You could have had a powerful message about consent but you loose it in your race focus which is 100% irrelevant when dealing with consent.
madalynalina: Yes! Yes to consent, yes to doctors offices, yes to having informed practitioners.
thegoldengrenadine: I actually had the same thing when I went in for a massage and accupuncture last week. It was the day before my wedding and she said "I'm going to do cupping on your back to get rid of the tension but it'll leave little marks so I won't do it too high up" but I was like "I'm not sure I want that as I never came in for this" but she did it anyway and it left some big old marks on my back which are visible in my wedding photos. Like, why pressure people into things? Just give them what they came for and be done. Glad it got rid of your cough though and you are feeling better

bwheeler3481: This is sad. Making it a #white #black thing. In my opinion you’re not helping anything or anyone. In fact it seems like you’re interested in starting drama. How? @ihartericka why? My next thought is, what you be saying if the Dr was a white human. choosing.amy: One theme of this evening’s therapy session was exactly this. Not just in physical and sexual ways but emotional as well. My therapist called it (of course with the disclaimer that it’s not to take away from sexual assault) “emotional rape.” When emotional safety and personal agency are violated. Happening chronically, to the point that one loses or is unable to develop a sense of self and boundaries, not knowing where one ends or begins. It is a pervasive societal/cultural issue for sure.
amy.zell: I would love to better understand your perspective on why white people shouldn't practice acupuncture. Could you tell me a bit more about that?
kazoodelee: Thank you for sharing your story, I thought I was alone. 💚 I had the same reaction when I was getting these weird bug bites that would swell to the size of my palm. I ended up with two stitches and crying in the bathroom afterwards.
leigh_jewellery: Informed consent for medical practices and procedures is HUGE.
